items.title: Cambuur shopt na succes met Ferrah opnieuw bij Lille
items.summary: SC Cambuur heeft zich versterkt met Ethan Apkakou (19). De middenvelder komt over van LOSC Lille en tekent een contract voor 3,5 jaar in Leeuwarden, met de optie voor nog een extra seizoen.

items.title: Britse media eensgezind over verrassende opvolger van Maresca bij Chelsea
items.summary: Liam Rosenior lijkt de nieuwe manager van Chelsea te moeten worden. Volgens de Britse media is de huidige trainer van Strasbourg de absolute topkandidaat om de donderdag ontslagen Enzo Maresca op te volgen. Een daarmee neemt de loopbaan van de Engelsman een opvallende wending.

items.title: Limbs at Fratton Park prove fan vlogs capture footballâ€™s most human moments | Max Rushden
items.summary: Yes, it is performative but videos from Portsmouth v Charlton showed joy, humiliation and existential doubt better than any highlight reel ever could I received a wonderful message from Bob in Kent while hosting the afternoon show on TalkSport on New Yearâ€™s Eve. â€œCanâ€™t believe youâ€™re still employing Max Rushden,â€ it read. â€œHeâ€™s so tedious. I still wonâ€™t listen while heâ€™s on. If you rate him, put him on with Simon Jordan, then youâ€™ll see his intellect. Is he cheap? Is that it? Please explain to me, why? Bob, Kent.â€ Seasonâ€™s greetings to you too, Bob. Iâ€™ve had worse. Bobâ€™s just curious. The truth is that not everything is for everyone, certainly I am not for Bob in Kent. The hope is that, as a broadcaster, you are at least bearable for a reasonable proportion of the audience, and on a good day even enjoyable to some. Continue reading...

items.title: The Guardian Footballer of the Year Jess Carter: â€˜I remember not wanting to go outâ€™
items.summary: England defender publicly confronted racist abuse at the Euros and ended 2025 a title winner with club and country The Guardian Footballer of the Year is an award given to a player who has done something remarkable, whether by overcoming adversity, helping others or setting a sporting example by acting with exceptional honesty. Jess Carter has spent her life grappling with when to hold back and when to speak up; wrestling with being naturally herself, embodying the characteristics her parents instilled in her of being open, honest, vocal and confident, and subduing herself because, while society values those traits, in a black woman they can be viewed negatively. Continue reading...

items.title: Retiring from football is difficult â€“ thatâ€™s why I want to help players learn from my experiences | David Wheeler
items.summary: Football provided direction, belonging, purpose and validation. Letting go of that has meant confronting the void left behind Accepting retirement from professional football has felt like stepping into a landscape shaped by loss and uncertainty. Even when the decision is rational, even when the body is signalling that itâ€™s time, there is something profoundly emotional about acknowledging that an era of your life has ended. To me, it felt very much like grief. The shock, sadness, anger, confusion and numbness mirror the emotional responses that accompany any major loss Iâ€™ve experienced. But instead of mourning the loss of a loved one, you are mourning the loss of a part of you â€“ a big part. For years football provided direction, belonging, inspiration, purpose and validation. A sense of being part of something bigger. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Best bargain' Kamara at heart of Aston Villa success
items.summary: Boubacar Kamara is Aston Villa's unassuming star and has quietly evolved into one of the best midfielders in the Premier League.

items.title: Fluminense verlengt contract van wereldrecordhouder FÃ¡bio (45)
items.summary: Fluminense heeft het contract van keeper FÃ¡bio met twee seizoenen verlengd. Hoewel de goalie momenteel al 45 jaar oud is, tekent hij toch voor twee jaar bij en daarmee kan hij een bijzonder record nog scherper stellen.

items.title: 'Vroege' CL-finale en gekortwiekte play-offs: 10 belangrijke voetbaldata in 2026
items.summary: Met een XXL-WK voor de deur wordt het sowieso een bijzonder voetbaljaar. VI zet alvast tien belangrijke data in 2026 op een rij.

items.title: Today on Sky Sports Racing: Quddwah headlines in Zabeel Mile
items.summary: We have a busy dayâ€™s racing on Friday with flat action from Wolverhampton and Meydan, live on Sky Sports Racing.

items.title: Bashir and Potts named in England squad for fifth Ashes Test
items.summary: Spinner Shoaib Bashir and seam-bowler Matthew Potts have been included in England's 12-player squad for the fifth Ashes Test against Australia, with Gus Atkinson ruled out.

items.title: Khawaja hits out at â€˜racial stereotypesâ€™ after announcing retirement
items.summary: Usman Khawaja has hit out against a culture of "racial stereotypes" in coverage of Australian cricket, declaring the sport is "still very white" as he announced his international retirement.

items.title: Pep Guardiola urges Manchester City players to get â€˜heads upâ€™ for visit of Chelsea
items.summary: Manager calm after â€˜really good gameâ€™ at Sunderland Chelsea visit Etihad on Sunday after sacking Maresca An outwardly sanguine Pep Guardiola suggested he was reasonably content with a hard-fought point at Sunderland after watching his Manchester City side lose ground on Arsenal at the top of the Premier League. The 0-0 draw at the Stadium of Light leaves City second, four points behind Mikel Artetaâ€™s leaders but Guardiola was not too downhearted. â€œIâ€™ll take the point against this team at this stadium,â€ said a good-humoured Guardiola who seemed unaffected by reports that Enzo Maresca, once his assistant at the Etihad Stadium, had discussed the possibility of relocating to Manchester later this year with figures associated to City. â€œIt was a really good game.â€ Continue reading...

items.title: Chelsea confirm Maresca exit amid poor PL run
items.summary: Chelsea confirmed Thursday they have parted ways with manager Enzo Maresca ahead of Sunday's game against Manchester City.

items.title: Pep says Rodri 'changed the game' in City return
items.summary: Pep Guardiola said Rodri showed Manchester City what they have been missing for a year and a half after the Ballon d'Or winner's substitute performance during a goalless draw at Sunderland.

items.title: Liverpool disappointed as unbeaten run goes to 8
items.summary: Arne Slot described Liverpool's 0-0 draw with Leeds United as a "disappointment" despite his team extending their unbeaten run to eight games in all competitions.

items.title: City lose ground to Arsenal with Sunderland draw
items.summary: Sunderland extended their unbeaten Premier League home record to 10 games after holding Manchester City to a goalless draw.

items.title: 'We are not happy' - Man City fall behind Arsenal in title race
items.summary: Pep Guardiola questioned whether it was only a two-horse Premier League title race, but his Manchester City side can ill-afford many slip-ups in their quest to hunt down leaders Arsenal.

items.title: 'Heavy metal? It's not even aluminium foil football'
items.summary: As Liverpool are booed off following a goalless draw against Leeds, it was hardly the start to the New Year that Arne Slot's side would have wanted.

items.title: Brentford draw with 'boring' Spurs on Frankâ€™s return
items.summary: Brentford were held to a goalless draw with Tottenham on Thomas Frankâ€™s return to his former club as Spurs supporters sang "boring, boring Tottenham" at the Gtech Community Stadium.
